title: Citizenship: Rights and Responsibilities

vocab.definition: A person who belongs to a community or country
Something you are allowed to have or do
Something you should do to help others
Treating others with kindness and care

teachingNotes: Connect to classroom and school rules. Discuss how students can be good citizens. Use real examples from school life.

sample.question: What is one responsibility you have at school?
What is a right you have at school?
What does being a good citizen mean?
Who helps keep our school safe?
What should you do if you make a mess?

truefalse.question: Rules are made to keep people safe and fair.
You should only follow rules when you feel like it.
Being respectful is part of being a good citizen.
You don't have to clean up if you didn't make the mess.
Only adults can be good citizens.

multiplechoice.question: What should you do if you see trash on the ground?
choices: tell a teacher or pick it up safely

multiplechoice.question: Who helps make rules at school?
What shows respect when someone is talking?
Which is a right at school?
What can you do to help your community?

fillintheblank.question: One right you have at school is to feel _____.
A responsibility is something you should _____.
We show _____ by using kind words.
We take turns and _____ our hands.
A good citizen tries to make the _____ better.

shortanswer.question: How can you show respect for your classmates?
Describe a time you helped your class.
What could you do if you see someone alone at recess?
What is one way you can help your community?
What should you do if you make a mistake?
How can students be leaders in class?
